docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton wants a set amount of drug company revenue to go to research for new therapies, an approach some critics call unrealistic.

headline.main: Why Some Policy Experts Question Clinton’s Plan to Contain Drug Costs

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton wants a set amount of drug company revenue to go to research for new therapies, an approach some critics call unrealistic.

docs.lead_paragraph: The costs have risen more than six times faster than workers’ earnings since 2010, Kaiser Family Foundation calculates, prompting some to forgo care.

headline.main: Health Insurance Deductibles Outpacing Wage Increases, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Health Insurance Deductibles Rising Faster Than Wages, a Study Finds

docs.abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation releases analysis that finds health insurance deductibles have risen six times faster than average increase in worker's wages since 2010; findings come amid concerns about consolidation in health insurance industry, which some fear will lead to higher costs for consumers.
docs.snippet: The costs have risen more than six times faster than workers’ earnings since 2010, Kaiser Family Foundation calculates, prompting some to forgo care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president has often turned to Roman Catholic members of his staff to secure Catholic support for elements of his agenda, and the efforts sometimes involve going around the church hierarchy.

headline.main: Catholics in White House Often Help Obama Build Support for Thorny Policy
headline.print_headline: Catholic Insiders Help Obama Build Support

docs.abstract: Pres Obama has secured Catholic support on some prominent issues by turning to Catholic members of his senior staff, including Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr and Health and Human Services Sec Kathleen Sebelius, and occasionally sidestepping church hierarchy.
docs.snippet: The president has often turned to Roman Catholic members of his staff to secure Catholic support for elements of his agenda, and the efforts sometimes involve going around the church hierarchy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The executives of Aetna and Anthem tried to assure Congress that their planned mergers would enhance competition, but a consumer group expressed doubts.

headline.main: Health Insurers Seeking Mergers Play Down Antitrust Concerns
headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Seeking Mergers Play Down Antitrust Concerns

docs.abstract: Aetna chief executive Mark T Bertolini and Anthem chief executive Joseph R Swedish testify before Senate Judiciary subcommittee about companies' proposed mergers with Humana and Cigna, respectively; senators are skeptical about executives' claims that mergers would benefit consumers and voice objections that  acquisitions could cause harm by reducing competition.
docs.snippet: The executives of Aetna and Anthem tried to assure Congress that their planned mergers would enhance competition, but a consumer group expressed doubts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton's plan to rein in prescription drug prices by reshaping how drugmakers do business is being met by skepticism within the industry.

headline.main: Clinton Plan to Reduce Drug Costs Gets Shrugs From Industry
headline.print_headline: Clinton Plan to Reduce Drug Costs Gets Shrugs From Industry

docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton's plan to rein in prescription drug prices by reshaping how drugmakers do business is being met by skepticism within the industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state technology manager who leaked former Gov. John Kitzhaber's emails to a reporter has agreed to resign in exchange for a $286,000 settlement with the state of Oregon.

headline.main: Oregon to Pay Settlement to Leaker of Ex-Governor's Email
headline.print_headline: Oregon to Pay Settlement to Leaker of Ex-Governor's Email

docs.snippet: The state technology manager who leaked former Gov. John Kitzhaber's emails to a reporter has agreed to resign in exchange for a $286,000 settlement with the state of Oregon.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican and Democratic lawmakers expressed concern about two multi-billion dollar insurance mergers on Tuesday, using a Senate hearing to take issue with the companies' arguments that they face expanding competition from new rivals.

headline.main: Antitrust Lawmakers Express Concern About Insurance Mergers
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Lawmakers Express Concern About Insurance Mergers

docs.snippet: Republican and Democratic lawmakers expressed concern about two multi-billion dollar insurance mergers on Tuesday, using a Senate hearing to take issue with the companies' arguments that they face expanding competition from new rivals.

headline.main: Culture Project Cancels Play Directed by Cynthia Nixon
headline.print_headline: Culture Project Cancels a Play,  Citing Theater’s Financial Woes

docs.abstract: The play, “MotherStruck,” written and performed by Staceyann Chin, is an autobiographical solo show about Ms. Chin’s effort, as a single gay woman without health insurance, to have a child.
docs.snippet: The play, “MotherStruck,” written and performed by Staceyann Chin, is an autobiographical solo show about Ms. Chin’s effort, as a single gay woman without health insurance, to have a child.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says it's getting harder to sign up those remaining uninsured under the president's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of two major health insurers planning multibillion dollar acquisitions made their case to Congress that bigger can mean better in their industry, but concerns are being raised in Washington about how these deals will affect consumers and competition.
